intro: Friesodielsia phanganensis, commonly known as the Phangan banyan, is a unique species of flowering plant native to Thailand. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and distinctive floral structures. The plant is known for its ability to form aerial roots, which help it anchor itself to trees in its natural habitat. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
